page.title: 08SITES OF HISTORICAL INTEREST
page.content: RALPH de TODENI, one of WILLIAM THE CONQUEROR'S noblemen, founded a { {PRIORY}at Astley attached to a French Abbey. The Priory was situated at the East end of the church. If you walk down the eastern side of the churchyard, water may be seen trickling from beneath the original stone arch of the{PRIOR'S WELL. } Immediately south of the church is an overgrown hillside sloping down to Dick Brook. Known locally as{THE {VINEYARD}it may well have been used as such by the men at the Priory. The bridge known as {NEW BRIDGE,} which connects the church and Glasshampton, has recently been designated a{PACK BRIDGE,}and talks are going on between the two owners of the land on either side of Dick Brook about its future upkeep.
